question: How to treat yellowing of leaves in rice?
answer:
Yellowing in rice (chlorosis) can have multiple causes:
1. Nitrogen deficiency: Apply Urea @ 20-25 kg/acre as top-dress
2. Iron deficiency: Spray FeSO4 @ 5g/liter with citric acid
3. Zinc deficiency: Apply ZnSO4 @ 10 kg/acre or spray 5g/liter
4. Blast disease: Use Tricyclazole 75 WP @ 0.6g/liter
5. BLB (Bacterial Leaf Blight): Drain field, spray Copper Oxychloride

Diagnosis tip: If younger leaves are yellow - nutrient deficiency. If older leaves - nitrogen deficiency.

question: Best time to sow wheat in north India
answer:
Wheat Sowing Calendar (North India - Punjab, Haryana, UP):

Optimal Time: 1-25 November (for timely sowing)
Varieties: HD 3086, HD 2967, GW 496, DBW 222

Late Sowing (after 25 Nov): Use late sowing varieties
Varieties: HD 2781, K 307, NW 1014

Seed Rate: 40-45 kg/acre (timely sowing)
Seed Rate: 50-55 kg/acre (late sowing)

Seed Treatment: Carbendazim + Thiram (2.5g+1.5g per kg seed)

Note: Each week of delay after 15 Nov reduces yield by ~40-50 kg/acre
